name: Fundamental Immunology
description: This course introduces the basic principles and key players of the immune system: differences and interplay between innate and adaptive immunity, how immune cells develop and function, how immune cells recognize threats and danger and mount an appropriate and measured response. This course is offered in the Fall term with in-class lectures and tutorials, as well as in the Summer term with hybrid delivery (online lectures and in-class tutorials).

instructors: L Clemenza T Mallevaey M Ratcliffe J Singh
